articles.title: Tim Cook says Apple ‘must’ figure out AI and ‘will make the investment to do it’
articles.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook boasted about the potential of AI and the company’s approach to developing it in a rare all-hands today that was reported on by Bloomberg. Apple has been slow to roll out some of its AI features and has stumbled with a planned AI-powered upgrade to Siri, which it delayed earlier this […]
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.content: Apple CEO Tim Cook boasted about the potential of AI and the company’s approach to developing it in a rare all-hands today that was reported on by Bloomberg. Apple has been slow to roll out some of its AI features and has stumbled with a planned AI-powered upgrade to Siri, which it delayed earlier this […]

articles.title: Why traditional VC is failing deep tech — and what can fix it
articles.description: Europe’s deep tech future hinges on evolving investment strategies. The reason for this is that traditional funding models cannot support the long-term financial commitments that innovation demands. There is a European paradox where, despite substantial scientific research, early commercialisation and a focus on shorter-term goals prevent the region from realising the full potential of deep tech. Although startups provide strong support, the sector still lags behind the US and Asia in bringing...
articles.author: Nikolay Shestak
articles.content: Europe’s deep tech future hinges on evolving investment strategies. The reason for this is that traditional funding models cannot support the long-term financial commitments that innovation demands. There is a European paradox where, despite substantial scientific research, early commercialisation and a focus on shorter-term goals prevent the region from realising the full potential of deep tech. Although startups provide strong support, the sector still lags behind the US and Asia in bringing...

articles.title: Python 3.14 release candidate 1 is go!
articles.description: It’s the first 3.14 release candidate! https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3140rc1/ This is the first release candidate of Python 3.14 This release, 3.14.0rc1, is the penultimate release preview. Entering the release candidate phase, only reviewed code changes which are clear bug fixes are allowed between this release candidate and the final release. The second candidate (and the last planned release preview) is scheduled for Tuesday, 2025-08-26, while the official release of 3.14.0...
articles.author: Hugo (noreply@blogger.com)
articles.content: It’s the first 3.14 release candidate! https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3140rc1/ This is the first release candidate of Python 3.14 This release, 3.14.0rc1, is the penultimate release preview. Entering the release candidate phase, only reviewed code changes which are clear bug fixes are allowed between this release candidate and the final release. The second candidate (and the last planned release preview) is scheduled for Tuesday, 2025-08-26, while the official release of 3.14.0...

articles.title: PEP 799: A dedicated ``profilers`` package for organizing Python profiling tools
articles.description: This PEP proposes the creation of a new standard library module named profilers to organize Python’s built-in profiling tools under a single, coherent namespace.
articles.content: This PEP proposes the creation of a new standard library module named profilers to organize Python’s built-in profiling tools under a single, coherent namespace.

articles.title: A simple twist fooled AI—and revealed a dangerous flaw in medical ethics
articles.description: Even the most powerful AI models, including ChatGPT, can make surprisingly basic errors when navigating ethical medical decisions, a new study reveals. Researchers tweaked familiar ethical dilemmas and discovered that AI often defaulted to intuitive but incorrect responses—sometimes ignoring updated facts. The findings raise serious concerns about using AI for high-stakes health decisions and underscore the need for human oversight, especially when ethical nuance or emotional intelligence is...
articles.content: Even the most powerful AI models, including ChatGPT, can make surprisingly basic errors when navigating ethical medical decisions, a new study reveals. Researchers tweaked familiar ethical dilemmas and discovered that AI often defaulted to intuitive but incorrect responses—sometimes ignoring updated facts. The findings raise serious concerns about using AI for high-stakes health decisions and underscore the need for human oversight, especially when ethical nuance or emotional intelligence is...

articles.title: Stop Using Vulnerability Counts to Measure Software Security
articles.description: A project with a history of vulnerability fixes doesn't mean it is less secure.
articles.author: Brandon Keller
articles.content: A project with a history of vulnerability fixes doesn't mean it is less secure.

articles.title: Building AIOps with Amazon Q Developer CLI and MCP Server
articles.description: In this post, we discuss how to implement a low-code no-code AIOps solution that helps organizations monitor, identify, and troubleshoot operational events while maintaining their security posture. We show how these technologies work together to automate repetitive tasks, streamline incident response, and enhance operational efficiency across your organization.
articles.author: Biswanath Mukherjee
articles.content: In this post, we discuss how to implement a low-code no-code AIOps solution that helps organizations monitor, identify, and troubleshoot operational events while maintaining their security posture. We show how these technologies work together to automate repetitive tasks, streamline incident response, and enhance operational efficiency across your organization.

articles.title: SabiYarn: Advancing Low-Resource Languages With Multitask NLP Pre-Training [Paper Reflections]
articles.description: In recent years, Large Language Models (LLMs) have mostly improved by scaling. This has primarily involved increasing the size of the LLMs and the data they are trained on, resulting in a highly resource-intensive process that can cost up to millions of dollars. While LLMs have become ubiquitous, the resource-intensive pre-training process poses a threat…

articles.title: The Search for Stability: Learning Dynamics of Strategic Publishers with Initial Documents
articles.description: We study a game-theoretic information retrieval model in which strategic publishers aim to maximize their chances of being ranked first by the search engine while maintaining the integrity of their original documents. We show that the commonly used Probability Ranking Principle (PRP) ranking scheme results in an unstable environment where games often fail to reach pure Nash equilibrium. We propose two families of ranking functions that do not adhere to the PRP. We provide both theoretical and...
articles.author: Omer Madmon, Idan Pipano, Itamar Reinman, Moshe Tennenholtz
articles.content: We study a game-theoretic information retrieval model in which strategic publishers aim to maximize their chances of being ranked first by the search engine while maintaining the integrity of their original documents. We show that the commonly used Probability Ranking Principle (PRP) ranking scheme results in an unstable environment where games often fail to reach pure Nash equilibrium. We propose two families of ranking functions that do not adhere to the PRP. We provide both theoretical and...
